alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 20 at 1:08PM PDT until March 23 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 8 feet with dangerous rip currents. Highest across west and southwest facing beaches. * WHERE...Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...From 2 AM Wednesday to 5 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
